item.title: Borderlands 4 pre-orders now available, post-launch content detailed
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/06/borderlands-4-pre-orders-now-available-post-launch-content-detailed

  • PC
  • PS5
  • Xbox Series

Story missions and new Vault Hunters.

Borderlands 4 is now available for pre-order, publisher 2K and developer Gearbox Software announced. It will be available in $69.99 standard, $99.99 Deluxe, and $129.99 Super Deluxe editions.

Pre-orders for any edition of the game will include the “Gilded Glory Pack,” which includes one Vault Hunter Skin, one Weapon Skin, and an ECHO-4 Drone Skin.

2K and Gearbox Software also announced plans to support Borderlands 4 with a “robust roadmap” of free and paid post-launch content rolling out following the game’s launch. This includes the downloadable content featured in the Deluxe and Super Deluxe editions. Full details will be announced at a later date.

Here is an overview of each edition, via 2K:

  • Standard Edition ($69.99) – Includes the base game.
  • Deluxe Edition ($99.99) – The Deluxe Edition will feature a variety of bonus items. This edition includes the “Bounty Pack Bundle,” featuring four separate post-launch downloadable content packs, each with distinct areas, new missions, and unique bosses; four Vault Cards with unique challenges and rewards; new gear and weapons; four new vehicles, and Vault Hunter cosmetics; and the Firehawk’s Fury Weapon Skin.
  • Super Deluxe Edition ($129.99) – The Super Deluxe Edition will include all bonus digital content from the Deluxe Edition. This edition also includes the “Vault Hunter Pack,” featuring two new Story Packs, each featuring a new Vault Hunter, story, and side missions; two new map regions; new gear and weapons; more Vault Hunter cosmetics; and new ECHO-4 cosmetics. Additionally, it offers the Ornate Order Pack with four Vault Hunter Skins, four Vault Hunter Heads, and four Vault Hunter Bodies.

“I’ve been blown away by how high the team at Gearbox have raised the bar for Borderlands 4,” said 2K president David Ismailer in a press release. “The development team crafted a premium AAA adventure that evolves the series’ gameplay and storytelling in new ways, while delivering on the quintessential Borderlands looter-shooter experience fans know and love.”

Gearbox Software founder and president Randy Pitchford added, “Borderlands 4 is the most excited the team and I have ever been to launch a Borderlands game. Borderlands 4 is the best entry point for new players while also being a heartfelt love letter to fans of the original games.”

Borderlands 4 is due out for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PC via Steam and Epic Games Store on September 12, followed by Switch 2 later in 2025.

item.title: DRAPLINE launches in Early Access on June 30
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/06/drapline-launches-in-early-access-on-june-30

  • PC

Raise the strongest dragon girl.

“Dragon daughter raising roguelite” game DRAPLINE will launch in Early Access for PC via Steam on June 30 for 1,200 yen, publisher and developer Vaka Game Magazine, and developer Kanawo announced. It will feature English, Japanese, and Simplified Chinese language support.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

A calamity that threatens the world is imminent… Raise the starving baby dragon you happened to find into your very own strongest dragon daughter!

Each game, lasting about one hour, is filled with random elements and choices. Experience a new sensation roguelite where you can enjoy different daily adventures each time you play.

Key Features

  • Each Playthrough is Just One Hour! – The “calamity” this time will arrive in just one year (!) From now on, players must raise Coo (name can be freely changed) with all their might every week to save the world. It’s a new sensation roguelite where you can enjoy different daily adventures each time with an incredibly free and cute dragon daughter. The secret lies in the abundance of random elements and the wide range of nurturing strategies. With short playtime per game, you can challenge it casually as many times as you want. So, what kind of dragon daughter will you raise this time?
  • Strategic Build Construction Through a Deep Nurturing System – The dragon daughter eats voraciously. You can’t help but smile at the sight of this free-spirited dragon daughter who casually eats not just wood, rocks, and iron, but even “things she shouldn’t eat”. Her personality changes depending on your “discipline”, and her battle style evolves dramatically as well. Through various ingredients and experiences, you’ll strengthen your dragon daughter’s stats with your unique strategy. The joy of trial and error as you aim for the strongest dragon is unparalleled. There’s even a “debt” system, so you might find yourself raising her while desperately managing money!
  • Multiple Endings Through Free-Form Gameplay – This free-form game allows you to raise completely different dragon daughters based on your choices. Depending on your nurturing approach, various endings will appear. For those who want to delve deeper, why not play again and again to discover all the endings? The dragon daughter’s growth is depicted through cute pixel art and abundant animations. However, if you persevere, you might uncover a serious story that you couldn’t imagine from the pop and humorous world view.
